bug.author: Ob1bob
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Issue Summary</denchmark-h>
Attempting to download any models or dependencies (opencv, caffe, etc.) from the URLs in the install scripts reveals that the website is down: <denchmark-link:http://posefs1.perception.cs.cmu.edu/OpenPose/models/pose/body_25/pose_iter_584000.caffemodel>http://posefs1.perception.cs.cmu.edu/OpenPose/models/pose/body_25/pose_iter_584000.caffemodel</denchmark-link>
The build process fails because the URL is inaccessible. Hopefully, the server is just temporarily down - but in case nobody is aware and the problem remains, I am posting this issue.** <denchmark-h:h3>Executed Command (if any)</denchmark-h>
%WGET_EXE% -c http://posefs1.perception.cs.cmu.edu/OpenPose/3rdparty/windows/%ZIP_NAME% -P %CAFEE_FOLDER% and other download instructions in setup/installation batch scripts. <denchmark-h:h3>Errors (if any)</denchmark-h>
Attempting to access the the noted URL, as of the time of posting this issue, yields a "Sorry, the page you are looking for is not found" error. <denchmark-h:h3>Type of Issue</denchmark-h>
Compilation/installation error

comments.comment:
Now fixed, sorry!
Hi, sorry - still seems to be down. :(
I'm also still getting a 502 bad gateway error
guys, you can search in google to download this caffe model and put it in right loaciton

It started working late yesterday, thanks! <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
On Wed, May 20, 2020 at 8:17 AM Ginés Hidalgo ***@***.***> wrote: Clicking on this link works;
http://posefs1.perception.cs.cmu.edu/OpenPose/models/pose/body_25/pose_iter_584000.caffemodel
If something is still failing, could you let me know the exact link failing?

Please, use instead G Drive links from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/CMU-Perceptual-Computing-Lab/openpose/issues/1602>#1602</denchmark-link> (Dropbox took them down for excessive number of downloads.......)
